marketNews.title: Other Hot News
marketNews.content:
1. The Ministry of Investment and Downstream reported that Indonesia's investment realization in 2Q25 reached 477.7 trillion rupiah (+11.5% YoY, +2.7% QoQ). This brings 1H25 investment realization to 942.9 trillion rupiah (+13.6% YoY), equal to 49.5% of the 2025 target of 1,905.6 trillion rupiah, with labor absorption of approximately 1.26 million people. Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in 2Q25 fell 7% YoY to 202.2 trillion rupiah, marking the largest contraction in five years and contributing only 45.9% to total investment realization in 1H25.
2. U.S. President Donald Trump announced on Monday (28/7) his plan to raise the base tariff for global imports to a range of 15-20%, higher than the April 2025 announcement of 10%. The statement came a few days before the tariff deadline on 1 August 2025, while dozens of countries have yet to reach a trade agreement with the United States.
3. Bank Indonesia Governor Perry Warjiyo said on Monday (28/7) that the central bank continues to look for space to cut the BI Rate to support economic growth, with timing and magnitude to be measured against global and domestic dynamics. Finance Minister Sri Mulyani affirmed that the Financial System Stability Committee will cooperate to maintain growth, and the government will prepare a third stimulus package this year to support national economic growth of around +5% YoY in 2025, focusing on domestic transport, tourism and year-end regional activities.
4. Finance Minister Sri Mulyani announced that the government will allocate state budget funds, including surplus budget, to four state-owned banks (Himbara): Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), Bank Mandiri (BMRI), and Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS). The exact amount is still under discussion. The placement aims to ensure that more than 80,000 village cooperatives (Kopdes) can obtain low-interest (6%) loans without draining bank liquidity.
5. The Advisory Council of the Indonesian Nickel Mining Association (APNI) stated that at least four large nickel smelters in Indonesia have partially or fully halted production during 1H25 due to oversupply and low nickel prices. The smelters include PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry, PT Indonesia Tsingshan Stainless Steel, PT Virtue Dragon Nickel Industry, and PT Huadi Nickel Alloy Indonesia.
6. Selamat Sempurna (SMSM) plans to distribute a second interim dividend for fiscal year 2025 amounting to approximately 201.6 billion rupiah or 35 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of 1.8% as of Tuesday (29/7). The cum-date is 6 August 2025 and payment will be made on 26 August 2025. Previously, SMSM paid an interim dividend of 25 rupiah per share on 27 May 2025.
7. Wir Asia (WIRG) shareholder PT Laut Biru Teknologi sold about 537 million shares at an average price of 124 rupiah per share between 24-25 July 2025, totaling roughly 67 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Laut Biru Teknologiâ€™s ownership in WIRG fell from 18.48% to about 13.98%.

tickerNews.title: Cisarua Mountain Dairy (CMRY) 1H25 Net Profit Beats Estimates
tickerNews.content: Cisarua Mountain Dairy (CMRY) reported net profit of 514 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (+24% YoY, +7% QoQ), bringing 1H25 net profit to 994 billion rupiah (+24% YoY), surpassing the consensus estimate of 59% of the 2025F forecast. Revenue from the 'Dairy Product' segment grew modestly to 933 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (+3% YoY, +8% QoQ) but was down 4% YoY for 1H25 due to a weak 1Q25 (-11% YoY, -16% QoQ). The segment's contribution to total revenue fell to 35% in 1H25 from 42% in 1H24. Meanwhile, the 'Consumer Foods' segment drove solid total revenue growth of +21% YoY and +11% QoQ in 2Q25, with the segment itself up +33% YoY and +13% QoQ; its 1H25 revenue grew +32% YoY. Operating expenses increased only +6% YoY in 1H25, allowing operating margin to rise to 22.2% (vs. 19.8% in 1H24) and operating profit to grow +31% YoY. Management expects 2025 revenue growth of +10-15% YoY and gross margin guidance of 42-44%. An earnings call for 1H25 results will be held on Wednesday, 30 July, afternoon. Since the 2Q25 release on Monday 28 July, CMRY shares have risen +5.77% to 4,950 rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Ultrajaya Milk Industry (ULTJ) 1H25 Net Profit Declines
tickerNews.content: Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company (ULTJ) posted net profit of 239 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (-32% YoY, -34% QoQ), resulting in 1H25 net profit of 604 billion rupiah, down 20% YoY. Total revenue fell to 1.8 trillion rupiah in 2Q25 (-16% YoY, -21% QoQ), the lowest since 3Q21, and 1H25 revenue declined 8% YoY to 4.1 trillion rupiah. The 'Dairy' segment remains the largest revenue contributor, accounting for 77% as of 9M24. Operating margin dropped to 16.7% in 1H25 (vs. 18.9% in 1H24) due to a 5% YoY increase in operating expenses amid falling revenue, leading to a 19% YoY decline in operating profit.

tickerNews.title: Hartadinata Abadi (HRTA) 1H25 Net Profit +69% YoY Beats Estimates
tickerNews.content: Hartadinata Abadi (HRTA) reported net profit of 199 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (+93% YoY, +33% QoQ), bringing 1H25 net profit to 349 billion rupiah (+69% YoY), surpassing the consensus estimate at 62% of the 2025F forecast and exceeding the management target of 58% of 2025 net profit. Revenue grew +96% YoY in 2Q25 and +83% YoY in 1H25, reaching 56% of the 2025 management target. Gross margin fell to 4.9% in 2Q25 (vs. 6.2% in 2Q24 and 5.1% in 1Q25) and was 5% in 1H25 (vs. 6.3% in 1H24).

tickerNews.title: Astra Otoparts (AUTO) 1H25 Net Profit Declines
tickerNews.content: Astra Otoparts (AUTO) posted net profit of 433 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (-20% YoY, -14% QoQ), resulting in 1H25 net profit of 939 billion rupiah (-7% YoY), equal to 45% of the consensus 2025F estimate. The decline is mainly due to a sharp drop in other income following asset divestments last year. Operating profit, however, grew +7% YoY in 2Q25 and +10% YoY in 1H25, driven by revenue growth of +2% YoY in 2Q25 and +4% YoY in 1H25 and an increase in operating margin.

tickerNews.title: Dharma Polimetal (DRMA) 1H25 Net Profit Slight Decline
tickerNews.content: Dharma Polimetal (DRMA) recorded net profit of 97 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (-6% YoY, -32% QoQ), leading to 1H25 net profit of 240 billion rupiah (+1% YoY), equal to 40% of the consensus 2025F estimate. Gross margin was 15.2% in 2Q25 and 16.3% in 1H25, down from 16.5%/17.5% in 2Q24/1H24. Revenue increased +8% YoY in 2Q25 and +9% YoY in 1H25.

tickerNews.title: Petrosea (PTRO) 1H25 Net Profit in USD Declines
tickerNews.content: Petrosea (PTRO) reported net profit of 0.2 million USD in 2Q25 (-87% YoY, -83% QoQ), resulting in 1H25 net profit of 1.1 million USD (-19% YoY), below our estimate of 8% of the 2025F consensus. The weak 2Q25 profit was pressured by a currency loss of 10.4 million USD (vs. a 7.1 million USD gain in 1Q25 and a 2.3 million USD gain in 2Q24). EBITDA reached 46.9 million USD in 2Q25 (+79% YoY, +94% QoQ) and 71.1 million USD in 1H25 (+51% YoY), aligning with our expectations (42% of the 2025F estimate, close to the three-year average of 43%).

tickerNews.title: BKSL Rumor on Sentul City Collaboration Clarified
tickerNews.content: CIO Danantara, Pandu Sjahrir, stated that the company is unaware of any cooperation plan with Sentul City. The comment followed rumors that Danantara would develop a special economic zone (KEK) focused on health services on land owned by BKSL. BKSL later clarified to the IDX that it has entered an early study and discussion phase regarding a potential PLTS project, as reported by Bloomberg Technoz. No further comment was made on the health-sector KEK rumor.

tickerNews.title: KRYA Announces Acquisition by Rich Step International
tickerNews.content: Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya (KRYA) announced that prospective buyer Rich Step International Ltd. completed due diligence on 28 July 2025 to proceed with the acquisition. The acquired shares will be allocated to Green City SG Pte. Ltd., a Singaporean entity owned by Rich Step International, Yang Jie, and Green Power Group ($LABA). Rich Step International plans to consolidate the business and acquire a 51% stake in an upcoming electric vehicle (EV) company. KRYA also aims to replace approximately 900,000 motor-ojek in Indonesia with electric motorcycles within five years and later expand to three- and four-wheel EVs. Funding will be sought through a rights issue and other means.

tickerNews.title: Radiant Utama Interinsco (RUIS) Plans Sale of Stake in PT Sorik Marapi Geothermal
tickerNews.content: Radiant Utama Interinsco, through its subsidiary PT Supraco Indonesia, intends to sell a total of 5% ownership in PT Sorik Marapi Geothermal Power to OTP Geothermal Pte. Ltd. (3.57%) and KS Orka Renewables Pte. Ltd. (1.43%). The transaction value has not been disclosed. The deal is considered material as it exceeds 20% but remains below 50% of the company's equity.

tickerNews.title: Government Places Funds in Four State-Owned Banks
tickerNews.content: The Indonesian government will allocate state budget funds, including surplus budget, to four state-owned banks (Himbara): Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), Bank Mandiri (BMRI), and Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS). The exact amount is still under discussion. The placement aims to ensure that more than 80,000 village cooperatives (Kopdes) can obtain low-interest (6%) loans without draining bank liquidity.

tickerNews.title: Selamat Sempurna (SMSM) Announces Second Interim Dividend 2025
tickerNews.content: Selamat Sempurna (SMSM) plans to distribute a second interim dividend for fiscal year 2025 amounting to approximately 201.6 billion rupiah or 35 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of 1.8% as of Tuesday (29 July). The cum-date is 6 August 2025 and payment will be made on 26 August 2025. Previously, SMSM paid an interim dividend of 25 rupiah per share on 27 May 2025.

tickerNews.title: Wir Asia (WIRG) Shares Sold by PT Laut Biru Teknologi
tickerNews.content: PT Laut Biru Teknologi sold approximately 537 million shares of Wir Asia (WIRG) at an average price of 124 rupiah per share between 24-25 July 2025, totaling roughly 67 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Laut Biru Teknologiâ€™s ownership in WIRG decreased from 18.48% to about 13.98%.
